member.name: M:Unigine.SystemDialog.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor.

member.name: M:Unigine.SystemDialog.setType(int)
member.summary: Sets the type of the system dialog.
member.param: Dialog type to be set: one of the TYPE_* values.

member.name: M:Unigine.SystemDialog.getType
member.summary: Returns the current type of the system dialog.
member.returns: Dialog type to be set: one of the TYPE_* values.

member.name: M:Unigine.SystemDialog.setTitle(char)
member.summary: Sets a new title for the system dialog.

member.name: M:Unigine.SystemDialog.getTitle
member.summary: Returns the current title of the system dialog.
member.returns: Current dialog title.

member.name: M:Unigine.SystemDialog.setMessage(char)
member.summary: Sets a new message of the system dialog.

member.name: M:Unigine.SystemDialog.getMessage
member.summary: Returns the current message of the system dialog.
member.returns: Current dialog message.

member.name: M:Unigine.SystemDialog.setDefaultButtonReturn(int)
member.summary: Sets a default button to be pressed by default when the user hits the Return key on the keyboard.
member.param: Number of the button to be set, in the range from 0 to the total number of buttons.

member.name: M:Unigine.SystemDialog.getDefaultButtonReturn
member.summary: Returns the current default button to be pressed by default when the user hits the Return key on the keyboard.
member.returns: Number of the button, in the range from 0 to the total number of buttons.

member.name: M:Unigine.SystemDialog.setDefaultButtonEscape(int)
member.summary: Sets a default button to be pressed by default when the user hits the Escape key on the keyboard.
member.param: Number of the button to be set, in the range from 0 to the total number of buttons.

member.name: M:Unigine.SystemDialog.getDefaultButtonEscape
member.summary: Returns the current default button to be pressed by default when the user hits the Escape key on the keyboard.
member.returns: Number of the button, in the range from 0 to the total number of buttons.

member.name: M:Unigine.SystemDialog.getNumButtons
member.summary: Returns the total number of buttons of the system dialog.
member.returns: Total number of dialog buttons.

member.name: M:Unigine.SystemDialog.addButton
member.summary: Adds a new button to the system dialog.
member.returns: Number of the new added button.

member.name: M:Unigine.SystemDialog.addButton(char)
member.summary: Adds a new button to the system dialog.
member.param: Name of the button to be added.
member.returns: Number of the new added button.

member.name: M:Unigine.SystemDialog.removeButton(int)
member.summary: Removes the button with the specified number from the system dialog.
member.param: Number of the button to be removed, in the range from 0 to the total number of buttons.

member.name: M:Unigine.SystemDialog.swapButtons(int,int)
member.summary: Swaps two buttons with the specified numbers.
member.param: Number of the first button, in the range from 0 to the total number of buttons.
Number of the second button, in the range from 0 to the total number of buttons.

member.name: M:Unigine.SystemDialog.getButtonName(int)
member.summary: Returns the name of the button by its number.
member.param: Number of the button, in the range from 0 to the total number of buttons.
member.returns: Name of the button with the specified number.

member.name: M:Unigine.SystemDialog.setButtonName(int,char)
member.summary: Sets as new name for the button with the specified number.
member.param: Number of the button to be renamed, in the range from 0 to the total number of buttons.
New name to be set for the button with the specified number.

member.name: F:Unigine.SystemDialog.TYPE_ERROR
member.summary: Error dialog.

member.name: F:Unigine.SystemDialog.TYPE_WARNING
member.summary: Warning dialog.

member.name: F:Unigine.SystemDialog.TYPE_INFORMATION
member.summary: Information dialog.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.moveToCenter
member.summary: Positions the window so that the client center coincides with the center of the current display. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, using this method for a nested window is not allowed.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.setMinAndMaxSize(Unigine.Math.ivec2,Unigine.Math.ivec2)
member.summary: Sets the minimum and maximum possible window size when resizing the window. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, using this method for a nested window is not allowed.
member.param: The minimum possible size of the window.
The maximum possible size of the window.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.setIcon(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image})
member.summary: Sets the icon for the window.
member.returns: 1 if the specified icon is successfully set for the window, otherwise 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getIcon const
member.summary: Returns the icon for the engine window.
member.returns: 1 if the icon for the window is returned successfully, otherwise 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.show
member.summary: Enables rendering of the engine window. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, using this method for a nested window is not allowed.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.hide
member.summary: Disables rendering of the engine window. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, using this method for a nested window is not allowed.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.setFocus
member.summary: Sets the focus to the window.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.setSystemFocus
member.summary: Sets the focus to the engine window. This method is applied to a separate or parent window, for nested windows use setFocus().

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.minimize
member.summary: Minimizes the engine window to an iconic representation. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, using this method for a nested window is not allowed.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.maximize
member.summary: Makes the engine window as large as possible. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, using this method for a nested window is not allowed.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.restore
member.summary: Restores the size and position of the minimized or maximized engine window via the system proxy. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, using this method for a nested window is not allowed.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getHitTestResult(Unigine.Math.ivec2)
member.summary: Returns a value indicating in which area of the engine window the mouse is located. This method is used for interaction with system windows only, i.e. it cannot be used for nested windows.
member.param: Global coordinates of the hit-test point.
member.returns: Value indicating the window area, one of the HITTEST_* values.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getHitTestResultName(EngineWindow::HITTEST) const
member.summary: Returns the string representation of the hit test result value.
member.param: Value indicating the window area, one of the HITTEST_* values.
member.returns: The string representation of the hit test result value (e.g., HITTEST_RESIZE_RIGHT is RESIZE RIGHT).

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.toTop
member.summary: Makes the window appear on top of all other windows. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, using this method for a nested window is not allowed.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.isGlobalChildOf(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindowGroup})
member.summary: Returns the value specifying if the current window is a part of a hierarchy of the specified window.
member.returns: true if the current window is globally a child of the specified one, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.updateGuiHierarchy
member.summary: Updates the hierarchy for all widgets — the widgets are arranged, expanded to the required sizes and then their positions are updated. Updating the hierarchy may be required, for example, for getting the screen position immediately after the widget has been added to the hierarchy. For a separate window, the hierarchy in self gui is updated; for a nested window, the hierarchy in self gui of the global parent group is updated.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getDroppedItem(int) const
member.summary: Returns the absolute path to the file or folder dropped to the window.
member.param: Index of the dropped file or folder.
member.returns: Absolute path to the dropped file or folder.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.screenshot(char)
member.summary: Creates a screenshot after the rendering stage is completed. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, using this method for a nested window is not allowed.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.setModal(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindow})
member.summary: Sets the current window modal to the specified parent window. Both the parent and the child windows must be separate. The concept of modal assumes that if a window has modal children, it cannot be closed. Any other interaction with a parent window is possible. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, a nested window can't be a parent for a modal window.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.addModalWindow(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindow})
member.summary: Adds the argument window as modal to the current window. Both the parent and the child windows must be separate. The concept of modal assumes that if a window has modal children, it cannot be closed. Any other interaction with a parent window is possible. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, a nested window can't be a parent for a modal window.
member.param: Window to be added as modal.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.removeModalWindow(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindow})
member.summary: Removes the argument modal window from this window. The concept of modal assumes that if a window has modal children, it cannot be closed. Any other interaction with a parent window is possible. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, a nested window can't be a parent for a modal window.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getModalWindow(int) const
member.summary: Returns the modal window for this window by its index. The concept of modal assumes that if a window has modal children, it cannot be closed. Any other interaction with a parent window is possible. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, for a nested window it will return nullptr.
member.returns: Modal window.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.unstack
member.summary: Removes the current window from a parent group.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.close
member.summary: Deletes the window if this window is not a modal parent or a member of a fixed group. If a window is a member of a fixed group, it cannot be closed (i.e. deleted).

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getIntersection(Unigine.Math.ivec2) const
member.summary: Returns the value indicating if the mouse is hovering over the window.
member.param: Global screen coordinates of the mouse relative to the main display.
member.returns: true if the mouse hovers over the current window, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getClientIntersection(Unigine.Math.ivec2) const
member.summary: Returns the value indicating if the mouse is hovering over the client area of the window.
member.param: Global screen coordinates of the mouse relative to the main display.
member.returns: true if the mouse hovers over the client area of the window, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getClient9Area(Unigine.Math.ivec2) const
member.summary: Returns the area over which the mouse hovers, one of the nine areas into which the window is segmented.
member.param: Global screen coordinates of the mouse relative to the main display.
member.returns: One of the nine segments the screen area is split into.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.get9AreaName(EngineWindow::AREA) const
member.summary: Returns the name of the screen segment as a string.
member.param: One of the nine segments the screen area is split into.
member.returns: The string representation of the segment value (e.g., AREA_TOP_LEFT is TOP LEFT).

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.globalToLocalUnitPosition(Unigine.Math.ivec2) const
member.summary: Transforms the global screen coordinates in pixels into units relative to the window client area.
member.returns: The coordinates in units relative to the window client area.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.localUnitToGlobalPosition(Unigine.Math.ivec2) const
member.summary: Transforms the position in units relative to the window client area into the global screen coordinates in pixels.
member.param: The coordinates in units relative to the window client area.
member.returns: The position in global coordinates.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.toRenderSize(int)
member.summary: Transforms the unit value to the pixel value.
member.returns: Size in pixels.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.toUnitSize(int)
member.summary: Transforms the pixel value to the unit value.
member.returns: Size in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.toRenderSize(Unigine.Math.ivec2)
member.summary: Transforms the unit value to the pixel value.
member.returns: Size in pixels.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindow.toUnitSize(Unigine.Math.ivec2)
member.summary: Transforms the pixel value to the unit value.
member.returns: Size in units.

member.name: F:Unigine.EngineWindow.HITTEST_INVALID
member.summary: The hittest result is invalid.

member.name: F:Unigine.EngineWindow.HITTEST_NORMAL
member.summary: Client area of the window.

member.name: F:Unigine.EngineWindow.HITTEST_DRAGGABLE
member.summary: Area of the window, by clicking onto which the window can be moved.

member.name: F:Unigine.EngineWindow.HITTEST_RESIZE_TOPLEFT
member.summary: Area of the window that can be dragged to resize the window to the top and/or left direction.

member.name: F:Unigine.EngineWindow.HITTEST_RESIZE_TOP
member.summary: Area of the window that can be dragged to resize the window to the top direction.

member.name: F:Unigine.EngineWindow.HITTEST_RESIZE_TOPRIGHT
member.summary: Area of the window that can be dragged to resize the window to the top and/or right direction.

member.name: F:Unigine.EngineWindow.HITTEST_RESIZE_RIGHT
member.summary: Area of the window that can be dragged to resize the window to the right direction.

member.name: F:Unigine.EngineWindow.HITTEST_RESIZE_BOTTOMRIGHT
member.summary: Area of the window that can be dragged to resize the window to the bottom and/or right direction.

member.name: F:Unigine.EngineWindow.HITTEST_RESIZE_BOTTOM
member.summary: Area of the window that can be dragged to resize the window to the bottom direction.

member.name: F:Unigine.EngineWindow.HITTEST_RESIZE_BOTTOMLEFT
member.summary: Area of the window that can be dragged to resize the window to the bottom and/or left direction.

member.name: F:Unigine.EngineWindow.HITTEST_RESIZE_LEFT
member.summary: Area of the window that can be dragged to resize the window to the left direction.

member.name: F:Unigine.EngineWindow.FLAGS_MAIN
member.summary: Main window.

member.name: F:Unigine.EngineWindow.FLAGS_CONSOLE_USAGE
member.summary: Usage of the console for the window is enabled.

member.name: F:Unigine.EngineWindow.FLAGS_PROFILER_USAGE
member.summary: Usage of the profiler for the window is enabled.

member.name: F:Unigine.EngineWindow.FLAGS_VISUALIZER_USAGE
member.summary: Usage of the visualizer for the window is enabled.

member.name: F:Unigine.EngineWindow.FLAGS_SHOWN
member.summary: Window is rendered.

member.name: F:Unigine.EngineWindow.FLAGS_FIXED_SIZE
member.summary: Window size is fixed.

member.name: F:Unigine.EngineWindow.FLAGS_HOLD_ENGINE
member.summary: Engine can't stop operating while this window is open.

member.name: F:Unigine.EngineWindow.AREA_BOTTOM_RIGHT
member.summary: Bottom right area of the window split into 9 parts.

member.name: F:Unigine.EngineWindow.AREA_BOTTOM_CENTER
member.summary: Bottom center area of the window split into 9 parts.

member.name: F:Unigine.EngineWindow.AREA_BOTTOM_LEFT
member.summary: Bottom left area of the window split into 9 parts.

member.name: F:Unigine.EngineWindow.AREA_CENTER_RIGHT
member.summary: Center right area of the window split into 9 parts.

member.name: F:Unigine.EngineWindow.AREA_CENTER_CENTER
member.summary: Center area of the window split into 9 parts.

member.name: F:Unigine.EngineWindow.AREA_CENTER_LEFT
member.summary: Center left area of the window split into 9 parts.

member.name: F:Unigine.EngineWindow.AREA_TOP_RIGHT
member.summary: Top right area of the window split into 9 parts.

member.name: F:Unigine.EngineWindow.AREA_TOP_CENTER
member.summary: Top center area of the window split into 9 parts.

member.name: F:Unigine.EngineWindow.AREA_TOP_LEFT
member.summary: Top left area of the window split into 9 parts.

member.name: F:Unigine.EngineWindow.AREA_NONE
member.summary: None of the areas of the window split into 9 parts is selected.

member.name: F:Unigine.EngineWindow.ENGINE_WINDOW
member.summary: Engine window.

member.name: F:Unigine.EngineWindow.ENGINE_WINDOW_VIEWPORT
member.summary: Engine viewport window.

member.name: F:Unigine.EngineWindow.ENGINE_WINDOW_GROUP
member.summary: Engine window group.

member.name: F:Unigine.EngineWindow.NUM_ENGINE_WINDOWS
member.summary: Total number of engine windows.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.#ctor(EngineWindowGroup::GROUP_TYPE,Unigine.Math.ivec2,int)
member.summary: Constructor. Creates the window group of the specified type and size with the specified flags.
member.param: The size of the window group.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.#ctor(EngineWindowGroup::GROUP_TYPE,int,int,int)
member.summary: Constructor. Creates the window group of the specified type and size with the specified flags.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.#ctor(EngineWindowGroup::GROUP_TYPE,char,int,int,int)
member.summary: Constructor. Creates the window group of the specified type and size with the specified title and flags.
member.param: The title of the window, in UTF-8 encoding.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.getGroupType const
member.summary: Returns the window group type set in the constructor — vertical, horizontal, tab arrangement of windows, or an independent window inside a group.
member.returns: The window group type.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.setFixed(bool)
member.summary: Sets a value specifying if windows can be added to this group or removed from it.
member.param: true to disable adding or removing windows from this group, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.isFixed const
member.summary: Returns a value specifying if windows can be added to this group or removed from it.
member.returns: true if adding or removing windows from this group is disabled, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.setAutoDeleteMode(EngineWindowGroup::AUTO_DELETE_MODE)
member.summary: Sets the automatic window deletion mode.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.getAutoDeleteMode const
member.summary: Returns the automatic window deletion mode.
member.returns: The automatic window deletion mode.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.add(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindow},int)
member.summary: Adds a window at a specified index. The window becomes nested (i.e. its borders, style, title bar, etc. are disabled). If the group is fixed, a window won't be added to the group and the console will display a corresponding warning.
member.param: The window order. If no index is set, the window is added as the last one.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.remove(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindow})
member.summary: Removes the specified window from the group. The window's settings are the same as before adding it to the group. If the group is fixed, a window won't be removed from the group and the console will display a corresponding warning.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.removeByIndex(int)
member.summary: Removes the window at a specified index from the group. The window's settings are the same as before adding it to the group. If the group is fixed, a window won't be removed from the group and the console will display a corresponding warning.
member.param: The index of the window to be removed.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.getNumNestedWindows const
member.summary: Returns the total number of nested windows in the group.
member.returns: The total number of nested windows in the group.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.getNestedWindow(int) const
member.summary: Returns the nested engine window by its index.
member.returns: Nested engine window.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.getNestedWindowIndex(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindow})
member.summary: Returns the index of the specified nested engine window.
member.returns: Index of the nested window.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.containsNestedWindow(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindow}) const
member.summary: Returns the value indicating if the specified window is a direct child of the current group.
member.returns: true if the specified window is a direct child of the current one, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.containsNestedWindowInHierarchy(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindow}) const
member.summary: Returns the value indicating if the specified window is a child of the current group or any of its children.
member.returns: true if the specified window is a child of the current one, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.setTabTitle(int,char)
member.summary: Adds the title to the specified tab and the window itself.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.setTabIcon(int,Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image})
member.summary: Adds the image to the specified tab and the window itself.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.setCurrentTab
member.summary: Sets the index of the currently active tab in a tab group.
member.returns: The index of the tab to set as currently active.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.getCurrentTab const
member.summary: Returns the index of the currently active tab in a tab group.
member.returns: The index of the currently active tab.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.getTabWidth(int) const
member.summary: Returns the width of the tab. Available for horizontal groups only.
member.returns: The width of the the tab.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.getTabHeight(int) const
member.summary: Returns the height of the tab. Available for vertical groups only.
member.returns: The height of the tab.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.getTabBarWidth(int) const
member.summary: Returns the width of the tab bar.
member.returns: The width of the tab bar.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.getTabBarHeight(int) const
member.summary: Returns the height of the tab bar.
member.returns: The height of the tab bar.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.getTabLocalPosition(int) const
member.summary: Returns the screen position of the tab relatively to the parent group (global window). The coordinates represent the displacement from the top left corner of the parent group (global window).
member.returns: The screen position of the tab relatively to the parent group (global window).

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.getTabBarLocalPosition(int) const
member.summary: Returns the screen position of the tab bar relatively to the parent group (global window). The coordinates represent the displacement from the top left corner of the parent group (global window).
member.returns: The screen position of the tab bar relatively to the parent group (global window).

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.setHorizontalTabWidth(int,int)
member.summary: Sets the width of the tab in the group of tabs arranged horizontally. You may need to call updateGuiHierarchy() first, if you have added a new window to the group and want to change its tab width immediately. Otherwise, you may get incorrect results.
member.param: The width of the tab in the group of tabs arranged horizontally.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.setVerticalTabHeight(int,int)
member.summary: Sets the height of the tab in the group of tabs arranged vertically. You may need to call updateGuiHierarchy() first, if you have added a new window to the group and want to change its tab height immediately. Otherwise, you may get incorrect results.
member.param: The height of the tab in the group of tabs arranged vertically.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.getSeparatorWidth const
member.summary: Returns the width of the vertical line separating a tab group from the rest of the area. You may need to call updateGuiHierarchy() first, if you have added a new window to the group and want to access its separator immediately. Otherwise, you may get incorrect results.
member.returns: The width of the separation line, in pixels.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.getSeparatorHeight const
member.summary: Returns the height of the horizontal line separating a tab group from the rest of the area. You may need to call updateGuiHierarchy() first, if you have added a new window to the group and want to access its separator immediately. Otherwise, you may get incorrect results.
member.returns: The height of the separation line, in pixels.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.setSeparatorPosition(int,int)
member.summary: Sets the position of the line separating a tab group from the rest of the area. The separator line can be horizontal or vertical depending on the group type. You may need to call updateGuiHierarchy() first, if you have added a new window to the group and want to change its separator immediately. Otherwise, you may get incorrect results.
member.param: Position of the separation line, in pixels, from the top-left corner of the window.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.getSeparatorPosition(int) const
member.summary: Returns the position of the line separating a tab group from the rest of the area. The separator line can be horizontal or vertical depending on the group type. You may need to call updateGuiHierarchy() first, if you have added a new window to the group and want to access its separator immediately. Otherwise, you may get incorrect results.
member.returns: Position of the separation line, in pixels, from the top-left corner of the window.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.setSeparatorValue(int,float)
member.summary: Sets the relative position of the tab separator. You may need to call updateGuiHierarchy() first, if you have added a new window to the group and want to change its separator immediately. Otherwise, you may get incorrect results.
member.param: Position of the tab separator, the value from 0 to 1 that is recalculated to pixels.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.getSeparatorValue(int) const
member.summary: Returns the relative position of the tab separator. You may need to call updateGuiHierarchy() first, if you have added a new window to the group and want to access its separator immediately. Otherwise, you may get incorrect results.
member.returns: Position of the tab separator, the value from 0 to 1.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.swapTabs(int,int)
member.summary: Swaps the specified tabs. If the group is fixed, tabs won't be swapped and the console will display a corresponding warning.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.getIntersectionTabBar(Unigine.Math.ivec2)
member.summary: Returns the value indicating if the mouse is hovering over the window tab bar.
member.param: Global screen coordinates of the mouse relative to the main display.
member.returns: 1 if the mouse hovers over the window tab bar, otherwise 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.getIntersectionTabBarArea(Unigine.Math.ivec2)
member.summary: Returns the value indicating if the mouse is hovering over the window tab bar area.
member.param: Global screen coordinates of the mouse relative to the main display.
member.returns: 1 if the mouse hovers over the window tab bar area, otherwise 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.getIntersectedItemPosition const
member.summary: Returns the position of the left top corner of the intersected group item in the screen coordinates. In case of several displays, the position is relative to the main display.
member.returns: The screen position of the intersected item — coordinates of the left top corner.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.getIntersectedItemSize const
member.summary: Returns the size of the intersected item.
member.returns: The size of the intersected item, in pixels.

member.name: F:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.GROUP_TYPE_NONE
member.summary: A separate window inside the group.

member.name: F:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.GROUP_TYPE_TAB
member.summary: Windows are arranged into a group of tabs with a selected window displayed atop the others in the group.

member.name: F:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.GROUP_TYPE_HORIZONTAL
member.summary: Windows are arranged into a horizontally displayed group.

member.name: F:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.GROUP_TYPE_VERTICAL
member.summary: Windows are arranged into a vertically displayed group.

member.name: F:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.AUTO_DELETE_MODE_NONE
member.summary: Automatic deletion of the window is disabled.

member.name: F:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.AUTO_DELETE_MODE_EMPTY
member.summary: A window group is deleted automatically if it doesn't contain any nested windows.

member.name: F:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.AUTO_DELETE_MODE_SINGLE_WINDOW
member.summary: A group is deleted automatically, if only one window is left. If this was a child group, it is automatically transformed to a child window.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowViewport.#ctor(Unigine.Math.ivec2,int)
member.summary: Constructor. Creates the window viewport of the specified size with the specified flags.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowViewport.#ctor(int,int,int)
member.summary: Constructor. Creates the window viewport of the specified size with the specified flags.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowViewport.#ctor(char,int,int,int)
member.summary: Constructor. Creates the window viewport of the specified size with the specified title and flags.
member.param: The title of the window, in UTF-8 encoding.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowViewport.disableFullscreen
member.summary: Disables the fullscreen mode for the window in the fullscreen mode and sets the focus to this window. States and positions of other windows are restored. This method can't be applied to nested windows.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowViewport.enableFullscreen(int,int)
member.summary: Enables the specified fullscreen mode for the specified display. The states of other displayed windows are stored in order to restore their states and positions when the fullscreen mode is disabled. A nested window will be withdrawn from the group if set to fullscreen.
member.param: Index of the mode supported by the display.
member.returns: true if the specified fullscreen mode has been enabled for the specified display; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowViewport.addChild(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Widget},int)
member.summary: Adds the specified widget as a child to the client area of the engine window.
member.param: Widget flags: one of the ALIGN_* pre-defined variables. This is an optional parameter.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowViewport.removeChild(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Widget})
member.summary: Removes the specified widget from the engine window.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowViewport.getChild(int)
member.summary: Returns the child widget by its index.
member.returns: Child widget.

member.name: M:Unigine.EngineWindowViewport.isChild(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Widget})
member.summary: Checks if the argument widget is the child of the current window viewport.
member.returns: true if the widget is the child of the current window viewport; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.WindowManager.getWindow(int)
member.summary: Returns the window by its index.
member.returns: Engine window.

member.name: M:Unigine.WindowManager.getWindowIndex(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindow}) const
member.summary: Returns the index of the specified window.
member.returns: Index of the window.

member.name: M:Unigine.WindowManager.stack(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindow},Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindow},EngineWindowGroup::GROUP_TYPE,int,bool)
member.summary: Stacks the window to the other window. If the first argument is the separate window, a new window group is returned. If the first argument is the nested window, the window is added to its group. group_1 will consist of 3 windows: window_1 and window_3 stacked vertically and window_2 stacked horizontally.
member.param: The parent window to which another window is stacked.
Type of a group to be created.
Flag to decompose the second argument of the merge, if it is a group, and combine with the first group.
member.returns: Group of stacked windows.

member.name: M:Unigine.WindowManager.stackToParentGroup(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindow},Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindow},int,bool)
member.summary: Stacks the second window to the parent window group of the first window. In the result, both windows passed as arguments will be on the same level in the group hierarchy. If the first window has no parent group, the function will return it as is.
member.param: The window into the parent group of which the other window is stacked.
A place where a window or a group should be placed in a group.
Flag to decompose the second argument of the merge, if it is a group, and combine with the first window or a group.
member.returns: Group of windows.

member.name: M:Unigine.WindowManager.stackWindows(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindowViewport},Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindowViewport},EngineWindowGroup::GROUP_TYPE)
member.summary: Returns a newly created group of the separate and/or nested windows. You cannot stack the window group to the separate window, however, you can stack a window nested in the window group: in this case, the window will be unstacked from its parent group and added to the new one. The windows are stacked in the default order. For example: group_1 will be a vertical group of window_3 and window_1.
member.param: Type of a group to be created.
member.returns: Group of windows.

member.name: M:Unigine.WindowManager.stackWithWindow(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindowViewport},Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindow},EngineWindowGroup::GROUP_TYPE,bool)
member.summary: Returns a newly created group of the engine window viewport and any other engine window — another viewport or a window group.
member.param: The window viewport to be stacked.
Type of a window group to be created.
Flag to decompose the second argument of the merge, if it is a group, and combine with the first group.
member.returns: Group of windows.

member.name: M:Unigine.WindowManager.stackGroups(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindowGroup},Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindowGroup},EngineWindowGroup::GROUP_TYPE)
member.summary: Returns the group of window groups. The second group is added to the first group. To combine two windows or a group and a window, use the stack() method.
member.param: The first window group for merging.
The second window group for merging.
Type of a group to be created.
member.returns: Group of windows.

member.name: M:Unigine.WindowManager.stackToGroup(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindowGroup},Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindow},int,bool)
member.summary: Stacks the window or window group to another window group. The updated group of windows is returned.
member.param: The parent group to which another group is stacked.
The window or window group to be stacked.
A place where a window or a group should be placed in a group.
Flag to decompose the second argument of the merge and combine with the first group.
member.returns: Group of stacked windows.

member.name: M:Unigine.WindowManager.unstack(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindow})
member.summary: Removes a window or a group from a parent group. If there is only one window left, the group is automatically deleted after removing the window from it.
member.param: A window or a group to be removed from a parent group.

member.name: M:Unigine.WindowManager.isFullscreenWindow(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindow})
member.summary: Returns the value indicating if the specified window is in a fullscreen state.
member.returns: true if the engine window is the fullscreen state, false if it is in the window mode.

member.name: M:Unigine.WindowManager.getFullscreenWindow const
member.summary: Returns the first engine window viewport that is in the fullscreen state.
member.returns: The viewport in the fullscreen state, or nullptr if no window is found.

member.name: M:Unigine.WindowManager.getWindowByID(unsignedlonglong) const
member.summary: Returns the window by its ID.
member.returns: Window with the specified ID, or nullptr if the window is not found.

member.summary: Displays a message dialog with the specified title and text.
member.param: Title of the message dialog to be displayed.
member.returns: true if the message is displayed successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.WindowManager.dialogWarning(char,char)
member.summary: Displays a warning dialog with the specified title and text.
member.param: Title of the warning dialog to be displayed.
Warning message text to be displayed.
member.returns: true if the message is displayed successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.WindowManager.dialogError(char,char)
member.summary: Displays an error dialog with the specified title and text.
member.param: Title of the error dialog to be displayed.
Error message text to be displayed.
member.returns: true if the message is displayed successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.WindowManager.showSystemDialog(Unigine.Ptr{SystemDialog})
member.summary: Displays a custom system dialog with an arbitrary set of buttons.
member.param: SystemDialog class instance representing the custom system dialog to be shown.
member.returns: Number of the dialog button clicked by the user; or -1 if an error has occurred.

member.name: M:Unigine.WindowManager.dialogOpenFolder(char)
member.summary: Opens a common dialog enabling the user to specify a folder to open. When the dialog opens the specified default path shall be set displaying the corresponding elements.
member.param: Path to be set by default when the dialog opens.
member.returns: Resulting folder name specified by the user.

member.name: M:Unigine.WindowManager.dialogOpenFolder
member.summary: Opens a common dialog enabling the user to specify a folder to open.
member.returns: Resulting folder name specified by the user.

member.name: M:Unigine.WindowManager.dialogOpenFiles(char,char)
member.summary: Opens a common dialog enabling the user to specify a list of filenames to open multiple files. When the dialog opens the specified default path and file filter shall be set displaying the corresponding elements.
member.param: Path to be set by default when the dialog opens.
File name filter string to be set by default when the dialog opens. This filter string determines file type choices to be displayed in the Files of type box.
member.returns: Resulting list of filenames specified by the user.

member.name: M:Unigine.WindowManager.dialogOpenFiles(char)
member.summary: Opens a common dialog enabling the user to specify a list of filenames to open multiple files. When the dialog opens the specified default path shall be set displaying the corresponding elements.
member.param: Path to be set by default when the dialog opens.
member.returns: Resulting list of filenames specified by the user.

member.name: M:Unigine.WindowManager.dialogOpenFiles
member.summary: Opens a common dialog enabling the user to specify a list of filenames to open multiple files.
member.returns: Resulting list of filenames specified by the user.

member.name: M:Unigine.WindowManager.dialogOpenFile(char,char)
member.summary: Opens a common dialog enabling the user to specify a filename to open a file. When the dialog opens the specified default path and file filter shall be set displaying the corresponding elements.
member.param: Path to be set by default when the dialog opens.
File name filter string to be set by default when the dialog opens. This filter string determines file type choices to be displayed in the Files of type box.
member.returns: Resulting filename specified by the user.

member.name: M:Unigine.WindowManager.dialogOpenFile(char)
member.summary: Opens a common dialog enabling the user to specify a filename to open a file. When the dialog opens the specified default path shall be set displaying the corresponding elements.
member.param: Path to be set by default when the dialog opens.
member.returns: Resulting filename specified by the user.

member.name: M:Unigine.WindowManager.dialogOpenFile
member.summary: Opens a common dialog enabling the user to specify a filename to open a file.
member.returns: Resulting filename specified by the user.

member.name: M:Unigine.WindowManager.dialogSaveFile(char,char)
member.summary: Opens a common dialog enabling the user to specify a filename to save a file as. When the dialog opens the specified default path and file filter shall be set displaying the corresponding elements.
member.param: Path to be set by default when the dialog opens.
File name filter string to be set by default when the dialog opens. This filter string determines file type choices to be displayed in the Save as file type or Files of type box.
member.returns: Resulting filename specified by the user.

member.name: M:Unigine.WindowManager.dialogSaveFile(char)
member.summary: Opens a common dialog enabling the user to specify a filename to save a file as. When the dialog opens the specified default path shall be set displaying the corresponding elements.
member.param: Path to be set by default when the dialog opens.
member.returns: Resulting filename specified by the user.

member.name: M:Unigine.WindowManager.dialogSaveFile
member.summary: Opens a common dialog enabling the user to specify a filename to save a file as.
member.returns: Resulting filename specified by the user.

member.name: M:Unigine.WindowManager.getIntersection(Unigine.Math.ivec2,Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindow},int,Unigine.VectorAllocator}) const
member.summary: Returns the window the intersection with which is detected.
member.param: The position of the intersection point in global coordinates.
The windows to be excluded from the intersection detection.
member.returns: The window the intersection with which is detected.

member.name: M:Unigine.WindowManager.getIntersection(Unigine.Math.ivec2) const
member.summary: Returns the window the intersection with which is detected.
member.param: The position of the intersection point in global coordinates.
member.returns: The window the intersection with which is detected.

member.name: M:Unigine.WindowManager.forceUpdateWindowOrders
member.summary: Updates the Z order of all windows. It is recommended to use this method only when required, because it is very slow.

member.name: M:Unigine.WindowManager.setEventsFilter(Unigine.Ptr{InputEvent})
member.summary: Sets a callback function to be executed on receiving input events. This input event filter enables you to reject certain input events for the Engine and get necessary information on all input events.

member.name: F:Unigine.WindowManager.DPI_AWARENESS_PER_MONITOR_AWARE
member.summary: Windows get the DPI level from each display individually. Not available on Linux.

member.name: F:Unigine.WindowManager.DPI_AWARENESS_SYSTEM_AWARE
member.summary: The DPI level of the main system display is obtained. Only with this DPI level the image is displayed clearly. Displays with another DPI level of changing of the DPI value on the main system display while running the application will cause the image blurring.

member.name: F:Unigine.WindowManager.DPI_AWARENESS_UNAWARE
member.summary: Scaling is not taken into account. Windows are displayed with the default DPI level of 96 (100%). The operating system will stretch the raster part of the window and it will look blurry.

member.name: F:Unigine.WindowManager.DPI_AWARENESS_CUSTOM
member.summary: The DPI awareness is set not on the engine side. For example, when the application is integrated via CustomSystemProxy, the user sets the required mode.

member.summary: Generic window event constructor.

member.summary: Sets the type of the generic action performed with the window during the event.
member.param: The type of the generic action performed with the window during the event.

member.summary: Returns the type of the generic action performed with the window during the event.
member.returns: The type of the generic action performed with the window during the event.

member.name: F:Unigine.WindowEventGeneric.ACTION_RESIZED
member.summary: Window has been resized. This event is always preceded by ACTION.SIZE_CHANGED.

member.name: F:Unigine.WindowEventGeneric.ACTION_MOVED
member.summary: Window has been moved.

member.name: F:Unigine.WindowEventGeneric.ACTION_SIZE_CHANGED
member.summary: Window size has changed either as a result of an API call or through the system or user changing the window size. This event is followed by WINDOW_EVENT_GENERIC_ACTION_RESIZED if the size was changed by an external event, i.e. the user or the window manager.

member.name: F:Unigine.WindowEventGeneric.ACTION_FOCUS_GAINED
member.summary: Window has gained keyboard focus.

member.name: F:Unigine.WindowEventGeneric.ACTION_FOCUS_LOST
member.summary: Window has lost keyboard focus.

member.name: F:Unigine.WindowEventGeneric.ACTION_MOUSE_ENTER
member.summary: Window has gained mouse focus.

member.name: F:Unigine.WindowEventGeneric.ACTION_MOUSE_LEAVE
member.summary: Window has lost mouse focus.

member.name: F:Unigine.WindowEventGeneric.ACTION_SHOWN
member.summary: Window has been shown.

member.name: F:Unigine.WindowEventGeneric.ACTION_HIDDEN
member.summary: Window has been hidden.

member.name: F:Unigine.WindowEventGeneric.ACTION_MINIMIZED
member.summary: Window has been minimized.

member.name: F:Unigine.WindowEventGeneric.ACTION_MAXIMIZED
member.summary: Window has been maximized.

member.name: F:Unigine.WindowEventGeneric.ACTION_RESTORED
member.summary: Window has been restored to normal size and position.

member.name: F:Unigine.WindowEventGeneric.ACTION_CLOSE
member.summary: The window manager requests the window to be closed.

member.name: F:Unigine.WindowEventGeneric.ACTION_UNSTACK_MOVE
member.summary: Window has been unstacked and pulled out of the group.
